channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed

item.title: Toxic Crusaders launches December 4
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Side-scrolling beat 'em up game dated.

Side-scrolling beat ’em up game Toxic Crusaders will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on December 4 for $24.99, developer Retroware announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

When the evil Dr. Killemoff attacks, only one team of hideously deformed creatures of superhuman size and strength stands between him and his plans for global pollution: the Toxic Crusaders, earth’s last, greatest and ugliest hope for survival! The hottest heroes of 1991 return for a radical, radioactive beat ’em up for a new era, featuring awesome action, crushing combos and more toxic waste than you’ll know what to do with!

It’s Clean-Up Time!

Choose from seven playable characters, including Toxie, No-Zone, Junkyard, Major Disaster and Headbanger (who would technically count as two characters if they could only agree on something)—plus, for the first time, play as Toxie’s musically “gifted” girlfriend Yvonne, and the mother of all mothers, Mrs. Junko, Toxie’s mom!

Battle across seven disgusting levels rendered in beautiful full-color pixel art as you defend Tromaville from hordes of Radiation Rangers, mutated thugs and zombie chickens. The odds might be stacked against you but with awesome powers, a winning personality and up to four-player local co-up on your side, the Smogulan Empire’s days are numbered!

Straight Outta Tromaville!

Take a deep breath and dive deep into an action-packed, pun-filled adventure that drags you kicking and screaming through the wonderful world of Troma. Enjoy cameos from gore-filled classics such as Class of Nuke ‘Em High, Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead, and Sgt. Kabukiman N.Y.P.D.—reimagined in the Saturday morning cartoon style that made this franchise so unforgettable!

Key Features

  • The triumphant return of the Toxic Crusaders, just when we needed them most!
  • Pulse-pounding beat ’em up action for up to four players.
  • Gorgeous full-color pixel art graphics.
  • A stunning soundtrack that’ll make you party like it’s 1991.
  • Amazing comic book cutscenes featuring the voices of TeamFourStar (Dragon Ball Z Abridged).
  • Seven playable characters, each with their own unique moves and powers.
  • Seven unique stages taking you from the streets of Tromaville to Planet Smogula and beyond!
  • Surprise cameos (each more surprising than the last) from across the Troma Cinematic Universe!

Watch a new trailer below.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/toxic-crusaders-launches-december-4

item.title: Silent Hill f – Everything We Know About the Brand New Chapter of KONAMI’s Horror Franchise
item.content:encoded:
After the highly successful remake of Silent Hill 2, KONAMI is about to launch Silent Hill f, a brand new installment in its acclaimed horror franchise. This is but one step in the Japanese company's grand plan for the IP, which includes the remake of the first title (also to be developed by Bloober Team) and the spin-off Townfall, which is being made by Screen Burn (formerly No Code).

But Silent Hill f is particularly significant because KONAMI felt that the series was progressively being westernized. This game, in development at Hong Kong-based studio NeoBards Entertainment, was instead conceived as a fully Japanese horror game.

Release Date, Platforms, Pricing, Editions

Announced on October 19, 2022 during that fateful Silent Hill transmission stream, Silent Hill f is set to launch on September 25 for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series S|X. Pre-orders are now open, granting all a White Sailor School Uniform costume, an Omamori: Peony equippable item, and an Item Pack that includes one Shriveled Abura-age, one Divine Water, and one First Aid Kit.

The Standard Edition is priced at $69.99, while the Deluxe Edition is $10 more expensive and provides access to the digital art book, the digital soundtrack, and a pink rabbit costume. Moreover, if pre-ordering the Deluxe Edition, users will get 48 hours of early access, which means they'll start playing on September 23.

Genre, Setting, and Story Premise

Silent Hill f is a survival horror game, much like previous titles. However, it will be set in Japan for the first time. More specifically, it takes place during the 1960s in the fictional town of Ebisugaoka, which was inspired by the real-life Kanayama, Gero, in the Gifu Prefecture, where mountains and forests cover more than 91% of the city area.

Protagonist Hinako Shimizu is just a regular high school student in Ebisugaoka until the isolated town is suddenly enveloped by a dark, mysterious fog. Ebisugaoka suddenly becomes silent as a grave, and it will be up to Hinako to investigate what's going on.

The story was written by the renowned author Ryukishi07 ('Higurashi When They Cry'), who KONAMI handpicked because they wished for someone who understood the Japanese horror concept. At its core, it is about terror possibly being found even within beauty: when something becomes too immensely beautiful and perfect, it becomes deeply unsettling. For his part, Ryukishi07 claimed that Hinako Shimizu (portrayed in the game by Japanese actress Konatsu Kato) is a protagonist who makes her own choices rather than simply being pulled along by the story. By the way, the story will be entirely standalone, although there will be some references to previous entries.

Fans rejoiced when they learned that historic composer Akira Yamaoka would return for Silent Hill f. Yamaoka has since revealed that he focused on infusing the game's music with the series' Japanese "essence," reflecting his own cultural identity into the work as much as possible. We also know that the sound team traveled to the aforementioned town of Ebisugaoka to record its unique soundscape.

Gameplay

Not much has been said or indeed shown about the gameplay of Silent Hill f. We do know it will follow the series tradition of offering players a variety of complex puzzles to solve, as well as many grotesque-looking monsters to deal with. We also don't know its estimated length, but we'll be sure to update this article if the developers provide any indications.

Tech and Specs

Like the Silent Hill 2 remake, Silent Hill f is powered by Unreal Engine 5. The PC system requirements were revealed in March and don't seem too taxing on paper, although we'll have to test the game ourselves to see if it runs well. The requirements also include confirmation that NVIDIA DLSS and other similar upscaling technologies (presumably AMD FSR and possibly Intel XeSS) will be included. However, we don't know yet if the game will also support frame generation techniques.

Minimum:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
OS: Windows 11 x64
Processor: Intel Core i5-8400 / AMD Ryzen 5 2600
Memory: 16 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070 Ti or AMD Radeon RX 5700
DirectX: Version 12
Storage: 50 GB available space
Sound Card: Windows-compatible audio Device.
Additional Notes: Playing on minimum requirements should enable playing on Performance quality settings at 30 at 720p. SSD is recommended.

Recommended:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
OS: Windows 11 x64
Processor: Intel Core i7-9700 / AMD Ryzen 5 5500
Memory: 16 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 or AMD Radeon RX 6800XT
DirectX: Version 12
Storage: 50 GB available space
Sound Card: Windows-compatible audio Device.
Additional Notes: Playing on recommended requirements should enable playing on Performance settings at 60 FPS or Quality settings at 30 FPS at FullHD (or 4K using NVIDIA DLSS or similar technology). SSD is required.



https://wccftech.com/roundup/silent-hill-f-everything-we-know-brand-new-chapter-konami-horror/

item.title: Poll: Box Art Brawl - Duel: Blast Corps
item.content:encoded:
Welcome back to the Brawl, my friends!

Last week, North America and Europe duked it out over Weaponlord on the Super NES, with NA giving their EU PALs a good wholloping and taking home 85% of the vote.

Today, we're looking back at Rare's Blast Corps, a delightful piece of nonsense from Twycross' 64-bit masters which saw you destroying everything in the path of a trundling warhead to prevent a catastrophic explosion. What can we say? Bananza's got us in the mood for smashing stuff to smithereens.

It's a duel this week, as the European version was just the NA version with the customary black border. After checking out the options, drop your vote in the poll at the bottom of the page and we'll see whether East or West is best when it comes to the ol' smashy-smashy.

Let's get blasting.

North America

The Western variant. shows J-Bomb standing atop Backlash with the bike (Ballista) in the bottom right corner, behind which the big red bomb-laden carrier is seen approaching.

The puddle at the bottom, the flying bricks, and the fiery billows from the collapsing building offer some visual interest and help distract from the blocky nature of the render. The logo in the top right feels a bit generic and the red stencilled 'BLAST' gets a bit lost on top of the radiation symbol, but despite being a bit disparate, we can't help up like this.

Japan

Whether you prefer the Japanese or North American cover, we can all agree that Blastdozer is just a better name, if only because there's zero confusion over the pronunciation and you're unlikely to provoke laughs in the playground when you tell your pals that Blast 'Corpse' looks amazing, instigating months of merciless ribbing.

Ahem. Looking at the cover, there's a lot to love. Cool mechs and big vehicles? Check. Explosions? Natch. Big red slogan slapped right over the centre? Boom. In honesty, 'BLAST 'EM ALL!' isn't the most riveting line, but we admire the bombast of putting it right in the centre of the blast, exactly where a less confident game would slap the logo.

And that logo at the bottom is a winner, too, boldly mixing the blue-tinged steel plating with the yellow and black warning barrier behind. We're not quite sure that that red, ticker-tape thing around the border is supposed to be, but we think we like it.

Thanks for voting! Remember that this one is part of the Switch Online Expansion Pack library, so if you missed it back in *checks notes*...1997...*has a moment*, you can easily catch up with this winner.

Otherwise, we'll see you next time for another Box Art Brawl.



https://www.nintendolife.com/features/poll-box-art-brawl-duel-blast-corps

item.title: Phantom Blade Zero Gets Fresh New Gameplay from S-PARTY 2025
item.content:encoded:
This week, Chinese developer S-GAME hosted S-PARTY 2025, a two-day event in Beijing during which fans could get hands-on with the highly anticipated Phantom Blade Zero. IGN India has posted a 22-minute gameplay video from this new demo that shows some hidden boss fights, secret item discoveries, and new weapons. We've embedded it below.

Phantom Blade Zero is undoubtedly one of the most eagerly awaited games in the action RPG/Soulslike genre, although as you might recall, the developers stressed that it is not to be considered a pure Soulslike game.

Last month, S-GAME CEO Soulframe clarified exactly what he thinks the game is:

Phantom Blade Zero is neither a Soulslike game nor a traditional action game. I've always admired the creators who defined these genres. I spent years immersed in their work, drawing inspiration and learning from their brilliance. But in the process of making this game, we stumbled onto a path we never expected:
At first, we just wanted to make a game that brought 'hack and slash' Into a multi layered map. But once the animations and environmental assets came together, everything was "stitched together" by a strong cultural aesthetic — creating something that felt deeply familiar to us, yet is rarely seen or experienced in games.

Broadly speaking, it falls under the category of ARPGs. But more specifically, maybe it could create a new identity that is Wuxia Action Games? Because here you'll get to experience:

  • Leaping across rooftops under a rain of arrows;
  • Fighting off pursuers atop a speeding carriage;
  • Uncovering the truth behind an incident that shocked the world years ago;
  • And even more iconic cinema moments.

Soulframe also added that Phantom Blade Zero will feature three difficulty settings (Wayfarer, Gamechanger, and Hellwalker, although the latter is only unlocked for a second playthrough with New Game+), unlike traditional Soulslike titles.

The game still has no release window, but we might learn more at Gamescom, where S-GAME is set to bring a large presence with a massive 500 m² booth in Hall 6 (B-050G) featuring over 60 demo stations. The demo is said to be the most comprehensive shared publicly to date, a full 1-hour playable experience featuring all-new boss battles, striking level design, immersive storytelling, and visceral blade-to-blade combat.

We'll be at Gamescom and look forward to checking out the new demo after reporting on last year's Phantom Blade Zero hands-on.



https://wccftech.com/phantom-blade-zero-new-gameplay-s-party-2025/

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 26/07/25
item.content:encoded:
Whatever do you mean that I forgot to do the round up yesterday? Yesterday was definitely Friday and I’m certainly not putting this together on Sunday morning. Absolutely not.

In the News This Week

Enough about that, let’s see what’s in the news this week, where we had a lot of delays and a fresh gaming controversy to deal with.

  • Itch.io delists all adult NSFW content due to pressure from payment processors and Collective Shout
  • Microsoft backtracks on $80 games, The Outer Worlds 2 will be $70
  • Clive Barker’s Hellraiser: Revival announced for PC and consoles
  • Terminator 2D: No Fate delayed to October 31st
  • Splitgate 2 goes back into beta, original Splitgate servers going offline, staff cut
  • The Chinese Room has gone independent again after a management buyout
  • The Dark Pictures: Directive 8020 delayed to early 2026
  • Dying Light: The Beast delayed to September
  • Project Cars 3 is being delisted, server shutdown announced
  • Elden Ring Nightreign’s two player mode arrives next week
  • Frostpunk 2 will chill PS5 and Xbox with a September release date

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Let’s start with the reviews with yet another indie horror treat heading up the week:

  • s.p.l.i.t – PC – 9/10
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV DLC  – NSW2 – 8/10
  • Wild Hearts S – NSW2 – 7/10
  • Shadow Labyrinth – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, NSW, PC – 6/10
  • Wuchang: Fallen Feathers – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 4/10

We also had some hardware in review as well:

  • GravaStar Mercury M1 Pro Gaming Mouse – 9/10
  • Edifier QR65 Desktop Monitor – 8/10

We’re not far from the start of the new football season – of course, there’s also that Euros final this weekend! – and with that, Aran went hands on with EA Sports FC 26 to see how EA has adapted to player feedback. In a similar vein, Gamoc has been having a more enjoyable time replaying The Last of Us Part 2 with its new chronological mode.

I dug into some racing games this week, putting on a VR headset to enjoy Le Mans Ultimate to its fullest with its v1.0 release, and previewing the second year of Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown.

And with everything that’s going on with payments and laws coming into effect, Aran welcomed us all to the new Internet.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Le Mans Ultimate, Wildgate & Monster Train 2.

Trailer Park

Battlefield 6 announced with a full multiplayer reveal next week

Surprise! Descenders Next is out now for Xbox and PC

Pokémon Legends: Z-A trailer reveals rogue Mega Evolutions, fashion and more

Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora third-person patch is coming in December

Your Achievements

What have you played this week?

  • Taking a break from the backlog, Andrewww played Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden and has rather enjoyed it so far. More people should know about this game!

That’s the round up for this week’s round up, enjoy the weekend and we’ll see you for more gaming gubbins on Monday.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/07/26/something-for-the-weekend-26-07-25/

item.title: 'The Hundred Line' Receives A New Update, Here's What's Included
item.content:encoded:
The Hundred Line - Last Defense Academy has been one of the Switch highlights of 2025 so far, and it's been getting regular updates since it launched in April.

The next patch is now available and we've got the full patch notes here via the official game website. This bumps the Switch release up to Version 1.1.1 and apparently includes improvements to various aspects of the game, as well as balance changes and some bug fixes.

Here's the full rundown:

The Hundred Line - Last Defense Academy (Version 1.1.1) - 26th July 2025

Specification improvements

Chapter Select

- Changed so that you can start from just before the choice
- Expanded the maximum display range of the chapter select screen

Battle

- Battle mode "EXTREME & Implemented "DESPAIR"
- Changed the recovery timing of battle mode "SAFETY" to "at the end of an ally's turn". Changed
so that battles that do not have similar battles can be skipped if they have been cleared once.
- Changed so that the start event can be skipped by "Restart Wave".

Field

- Added a UI that allows you to check whether a character is on the left or right side of the hallway.
- Reduced the strength of the flash of the morning and evening chime effects

Gift Machine

- Changed the timing of gift creation after selecting the character
to give the gift to. Changed so that filtering can be done from the "Wish List" when opening the list on the gift selection screen.
- Changed so that increasing grades can be checked from the "List"

Exploration:

- Changed so that some forced explorations can be skipped
- Changed so that battles do not occur randomly as a result of exploration choices.

Other

- Added a function to hide the message window on the conversation screen
- Changed so that the cursor position is saved when saving and loading.

Battle balance changes

Tsubasa Kawana

- Deserate: Expanded range

Kurara Oozuki

- Cannon battery: Increases attack power by 1
- Support tower: Expanded range,

Tsukumo Imama

- Winged Waves: Added [Fatigue Recovery]
- Bloody Angel Fist: Expanded range

Tsukumo Kasuko

- Energy Sniper: Reduced attack power reduction on self from -3 to -2
- Spirit Rain: Reduced attack power reduction on self from -3 to -2

Moshiro Moko

- Moko Dynamite!: Added [Armor +1]
- Ultra Moko Bomb! : Expanded range

Battle Stage

- Adjusted the balance of some battles
- Adjusted the actions and skill effects of some bosses

Bug fixes

General

- A bug that caused the game to crash when selecting "Chapter09_A_aba_099" or "Chapter09_A_abb_099" in Chapter Select
- A bug that allowed players to skip some unique battles even if they had not cleared similar battles
- A bug that caused the "direction of progress" and "color of the squares" to change when saving and loading during exploration
- A bug that caused the volume adjustment in the options to not work
- A bug that caused some effects to not be displayed during battle
- Fixed other minor bugs and typos

When we reviewed this game for the Switch, we called it an "excellent" tactical RPG – awarding it nine out of ten stars. Here's a quick sample, and you can see our full review below this.

"The Hundred Line – Last Defense Academy is an excellent tactical RPG that fully showcases the strengths of the creatives behind it. A well-written and compelling story, strong and strategic gameplay, attractive art style, and passionate VA work all come together to make for a comprehensive experience that you won’t want to miss."

Have you tried out this game yet? How about this new update? Let us know in the comments.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/07/the-hundred-line-receives-a-new-update-heres-whats-included

item.title: 10 Edge of Eternities Cards To Open If You Want To Win Your Pre-Release
item.content:encoded:
It’s time for the Edge of Eternities pre-release and with having gotten a chance to try out some limited play of the set in the MTG Arena creator event I can share some insights that might just help you win your Edge of Eternities pre-release... or know a bit more about the set, which we've been learning more about ever since the Edge of Eternities preview only a few weeks ago

Pain for All

This is a premium removal spell, and it plays really well in practice as well. On the surface, it is a relatively rare red ‘bite’ spell dealing damage equal to the power of your creature to an opponents, but there’s a lot more to this one. First of all, unlike other bite spells, Pain for All can also burn your opponent. 

Bigger and second of all, it also gives a ‘Stuffy Doll’ effect to the creature, meaning that when it’s dealt damage it deals damage to your opponents. With limited often involving a lot of fights, and the set has a higher number of high toughness creatures (16 commons, and 19 uncommons with more toughness than power) provoking ground stalls you can exploit with Pain for All.

Starfield Shepherd 

This uncommon flier is excellent to get, in large part due to it’s warp ability. Being able to warp this on turn 2 helps ensure that you have a land drop in the future, and holding onto it a little can trigger Void abilities that you have. While a 3/2 Flying for 5 is a bit undersized, when it comes with having fetched a pair of cards it becomes quite good. The Shepherd gets even better if you have a strong 1 drop that it can fetch as well, with the best option in the set being Rust Harvester.

Starfield Vocalist

In many sets, the Vocalist would be a buildaround type card left for people wanting to do whacky or strange drafts. But, Edge of Eternities is not most sets, and there are even more enters abilties then normal with Warp, as those creatures come in doing something then more often than not, and there are 62 creatures with ‘enters’ abilities. 

Interceptor Mechan

Gravedigger is always good, but this uncommon puts the venerable raise dead bringer to shame by not just flying, but working with artifact synergies and fetching artifacts, but also having the ability to grow. This thing is a machine and a strong reason to go black/red if you open it.

Fell Gravship

Speaking of Gravedigger replacement options, Fell Gravship is a spacecraft option for black decks, milling a few cards and then grabbing you a spacecraft or creature back. With the format being slower and more defensive, it feels like there is time for spacecrafts to be stationed, meaning the 3/2 flying lifelink body here can be quite useful.

Mm’menon, Uthros Exile

With all the artifacts in Edge of Eternities, and all the Lander creation going on in the set, Mm’menon here is able to grow himself or other creatures you have quite quickly and strongly. Without flying, Mm’menon would be still quite playable given the density of artifacts, with it, it can become a menace, to the degree it made my top 10 of best commanders in Edge of Eternities.

Seedship Agrarian

Landers are quite useful in Edge of Eternities limited, as they work to set up various artifact synergies, can hit void triggers, and in great especially make splashing much easier than it often is. The price is enough that I don’t think you can quite cut land over it, but in green with a couple of lander creators, you can splash a color quite easily. 

Of the lander makers, Seedship Agrarian is one of the best, as while its 4 mana, it makes a lander each time it’s tapped – making it perfect for stationing spacecrafts. Additionally, it grows whenever a land enters, something you’ll be doing a lot with this scientist working for you.

Skystinger

Skystinger is easy to overlook as a normal green lower cost anti-flying hate, but it’s important not to miss this little fellow, as it’s able to take on almost anything in the air. The air in Edge of Eternities come the late game can come to be occupied by some bigger creatures when certain spacecrafts get fully operational, but Skystinger for his humble 3 mana is able to take on almost all comers in the air.

Dual-Sun Adepts

White has ties to both go-wide and +1/+1 counter themes in this set, both of which go very well with this 2/2 Double Striker who also provides a reasonably priced team pump. There’s really not much to say about this guy, aside from he’s solidly costed and does precisely what white is looking to in general, and he absolutely loves to be the recipient of Honor.

Annul

The value of artifact destruction varies a lot set to set, but with 74 artifacts, the pendulum has swung towards high in Edge of Eternities. Annul is one of the most efficient pieces of artifact removal because it can do it for 1 mana as long as you keep the mana up – something players should be aware of also when facing blue decks. It’s worth running at least one or two pieces of artifact hate in your deck if you get it, though most of it is in red and green.

With that, best of luck at your pre-release and hope you enjoy Edge of Eternities!

A longtime lover of speculative fiction, in almost all its forms, Don joined TechRaptor in 2014 on a whim sending in an application as he was looking for… More about Don



https://techraptor.net/tabletop/features/10-edge-of-eternities-cards-to-open-if-you-want-to-win-your-pre-release

item.title: Poll: So, Have You Tried Out Pokémon Friends On Switch Or Mobile Yet?
item.content:encoded:
It got a surprise release this week

The latest Pokémon Presents broadcast earlier this week included the surprise release of a new puzzle game called Pokémon Friends.

It's available now as a free download on mobile devices and a one-time payment from the Switch eShop. Along with this are additional transactions, including DLC packs, which add more content and gameplay to your experience.

There's been a bit of a mixed response to not only the game, but also the DLC options, and it's got us wondering if the community here on Nintendo Life will be giving this title a chance. We're also curious to know if you've purchased any of the additional content yet.

So, vote in our poll and leave a comment below.

If you're curious to know more about this title, here's a bit more information from the official Nintendo website. We've also got a Switch review on the way, and will be delievering our final verdict on the title soon.

Unwind with puzzles in the Pokémon™ Friends game! Solve sets of three random puzzles to help untangle your mind—then place the yarn you obtain into the Plush-O-Matic: a special machine that creates in-game Pokémon plush! As you try to make them all, you can track your crafted plush in the catalog. You can also mark your calendar with a stamp each day you play, and then go back and practice the puzzles you played on those days.

Complete friend quests and get furniture to decorate your plush rooms

Folks around town will ask you to bring them specific plush. Finish these friend quests to give each plush a forever home and increase your friendship level with the townspeople. Grateful townspeople will give rewards, including furniture, which you can use to decorate your in-game plush rooms—along with all the plush you like too much to give away!

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/07/poll-so-have-you-tried-out-pokemon-friends-on-switch-or-mobile-yet

item.title: The Best Deals Today: Mario Kart World, Nintendo Switch 2, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, and More
item.content:encoded:
Mario Kart World goes on sale for the first time.

We've rounded up the best deals for Saturday, July 26, below, so don't miss out on these limited-time offers.

Mario Kart World for $71.99

Mario Kart World - Switch 2

Mario Kart World was the big Nintendo Switch 2 launch game, and today marks the first time we've seen the game on sale. Nintendo opted to release the game at a price point of $79.99, but you can pick it up for $71.99 at Woot. Mario Kart World features a brand-new open world design that interconnects each of the 30 tracks. A battle royale-like mode called Knockout Tour is hugely popular among players, as it offers a racing experience unlike anything we've seen in Mario Kart before.

Nintendo Switch 2 Available at Walmart & Target

Nintendo Switch 2 Console + Mario Kart World Bundle

While Nintendo Switch 2 has been quite challenging to find if you didn't secure one at launch, both Target and Walmart have the highly popular console in stock. This is the Mario Kart World bundle, too, which packs in a digital copy of Mario Kart World for $50. The Nintendo Switch 2 is an upgrade to Nintendo Switch in almost every way possible, featuring a 1080p display with a 120Hz refresh rate, improved Joy-Con, and much more.

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth for $34.99

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth - PS5

Final Fantasy VII Rebirth was my favorite game of 2024, and it's available for just $34.99 at Woot this weekend. This is the lowest I've seen the PS5 copies so far, and I cannot recommend picking it up enough. Cloud and the rest of the party leave Midgar to step into the open world of Gaia for the very first time, and there is well over 100 hours of content available for you to complete.

Pre-Orders are Live for the LEGO Game Boy

LEGO Game Boy

This week, Nintendo and LEGO unveiled the new LEGO Game Boy set. You can assemble your very own Game Boy in LEGO form, and there's even images of games included for the screen. Plus, this set includes buildable cartridges of some of the system's most popular games, including Super Mario Land and The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening.

Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake for $34.99

Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake was one of the most enjoyable RPGs of 2024, featuring a gorgeous remade HD-2D world and voice acting. If you haven't had the chance to check this one out yet, Amazon has copies available for only $34.99. This is by far the definitive way to experience this classic, and now is the perfect time to catch up before Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake this Fall.

Save on Breath of the Wild & Tears of the Kingdom for Switch 2

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild - Switch 2 Edition

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom - Switch 2 Edition

Woot also has both The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom for Nintendo Switch 2 on sale. These editions pack in both the original game on Nintendo Switch in addition to the Nintendo Switch 2 upgrade. Both games are some of the best experiences on Nintendo Switch, and they are even better on Switch 2 with support for higher resolutions and frame rates.

Ace Attorney Investigations Collection for $26.99

Ace Attorney Investigations Collection

Ace Attorney Investigations Collection brought both Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth and Ace Attorney Investigations 2: Prosecutor’s Gambit in one package, with Prosecutor's Gambit releasing in English for the very first time. This release features updated visuals, new animations, gallery mode, conversation history, and more. You can even switch between the old and new sprites! Both of these games are quite excellent, and I absolutely recommend picking this up, especially for only $26.99.

Originally posted:

Jul 26, 2025 7:35 pm

In This Article



https://www.ign.com/articles/best-deals-for-july-26-2025

item.title: Amazon are developing a Wolfenstein TV show
item.content:encoded:
“The story of killing Nazis is evergreen,” is the somewhat eyebrow-raising tag line for Amazon MGM’s next video game adaptation, Wolfenstein. Patrick Somerville, writer of the excellent The Leftovers, will be rather busy as creator, writer, executive producer, and showrunner.  Wolfenstein developer MachineGames will also be on hand as Executive Producers. although that title is rather honorific and does not necessarily mean they will have input.

This is not the first time someone has tried to adapt the franchise, in 2012, movie producer Samuel Hadida announced a film based on the games with Roger Avary, writer of Pulp Fiction, attached to write and direct.

No other details of the Wolfenstein TV show have been revealed but most games have featured William “B.J.” Blazkowicz, an American soldier who encounters Nazi’s dabbling in the occult. The first game was released… prepare to feel very old… forty-five years ago, in 1981.  Since then, there have been thirteen games, with the most recent, 2019’s Wolfenstein: Cyberpilot, being a spin-off set a week before the previous game, Wolfenstein:  Youngblood.

Sadly that game did not live up to expectations and we gave it 6/10 in our review, which was summed up with “Go home Wolfenstein, you’re drunk.”

Source: Variety



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/07/26/amazon-are-developing-a-wolfenstein-tv-show/

item.title: This brand new publisher is serving up fresh indie horror, including a sinister game of poker dice against demon billionaires
item.content:encoded:
Former DreadXP and Critical Reflex alum Ted Hentschke has teamed up with Jakub Bałuszek-Sobolewski to form Black Lantern Collective, a new publisher dedicated to horror games.

Described as an "all-new indie publisher leveraging the passion and expertise for established horror savants to bring a curated collection of chills, thrills, and unease to the freaky masses", Black Lantern hit the ground running with ten game announcements, but kicks off its release schedule with Captum Mortum, an atmospheric psychological horror game coming in August.

"Caput Mortum is a short first-person horror experience inspired by retro 3D dungeon crawlers and survival horror games," the team explains. "Delve into a tower of forgotten nightmares, where every step could be your last. Overcome horrors from beyond death and unlock the secrets of forbidden knowledge."

Also on the way is a first-person narrative adventure "about tagging billboards and watching your house burn down", Children of Saturn, rogue-like dice build Dead Finger Dice: A Billionaire Killing Game wherein you take on pole dice against blood-thirsty demon billionaires - as you do - and a "darkly quirky" RPG called Muffles' Life Sentence set in a prison where innmates are remade to match their crimes. The latter is out now on Steam.

To know more about the very best horror games released over the last year or so, check out the winners of the 2024 Horror Game Awards, where Silent Hill 2 Remake took home the top Game of the Year prize, as well as Best Survival Horror and Best Soundtrack. It also awarded James Sunderland mocap and voice actor, Luke Roberts, Best Performance in the third annual horror game showcase.

Best Indie Developer went to Chilla's Art, Best Multiplayer went to the brilliant Lethal Company, and the Chinese Room's Still Wakes the Deep took home Best Indie Horror, as well as Best Technical Achievement. Wrong Organ's stellar - if disturbing - Mouthwashing won Best Narrative and Player's Choice.



https://www.eurogamer.net/this-brand-new-publisher-is-serving-up-fresh-indie-horror-including-a-sinister-game-of-poker-dice-against-demon-billionaires

item.title: Wolfenstein is the next game series to get an adaptation for TV
item.content:encoded:
Because "the story of killing Nazis is evergreen".

Amazon MGM Studios has selected yet another video game series for a TV show adaptation - and this time it's Wolfenstein.

As reported by Variety, the exact plot details have yet to be disclosed, but the show's official tagline reminds us that "the story of killing Nazis is evergreen".

Jonah Nolan (aka Jonathan Nolan) and Lisa Joy - names you would've seen on the credits of Fallout - are already on board as executive producers, along with Athena Wickham, James Altman, and MachineGames' Jerk Gustafsson. Patrick Somerville will serve as creator, writer, executive producer, and showrunner under his production company, chaoticgood.tv.

Variety reports Somerville - who created the shows Maniac and Station Eleven - has reportedly been a fan of the Wolfenstein games "since he was a child".

Amazon is clearly looking to replicate the success of its hugely successful game-to-TV adaptation, Fallout, which has already been renewed for a third season on Amazon Prime, even though the show's second season's December 2025 debut is still months away.

More than 100 million people have watched Fallout's first season to date, Amazon has revealed, making it one of the streamer's top three launches ever. Amazon is now moving quickly to make more of the show, and begin teasing its second batch of episodes with another longing look at the Las Vegas skyline at the end of the below trailer.

Other in-progress TV adaptations at Amazon include a series based on Mass Effect, God of War, and Warhammer 40,000. In fact, Amazon is so confident of its God of War adaptation, it has ordered a second season before the first has even been aired.



https://www.eurogamer.net/wolfenstein-is-the-next-game-series-to-get-an-adaptation-for-tv

item.title: Predator Fans Mixed on Return of Dutch and Harrigan in Killer of Killers: ‘Harrigan and Dutch Had Good Endings. Zero Reason This Needed to Be Done’ |
item.content:encoded:
Arnold Schwarzenegger's Dutch is back in the world of Predator via an extended version of animated movie Killer of Killers — and it’s sent fans of the long-running sci-fi franchise down a lore rabbit hole that calls into question the endings of the original movies and what was thought to be a canon Predator video game.

This week at San Diego Comic-Con 2025, current Predator custodian Dan Trachtenberg announced a surprise extended version of Killer of Killers that shows Dutch from the original Predator and Danny Glover's Mike Harrigan from Predator 2 captured and frozen by the Yautja. Trachtenberg said during a panel at Comic-Con that Schwarzenegger had given his blessing to use Dutch in future stories, leaving the door open to a Killer of Killers follow-up that would see Dutch and co revived and pitted against a Predator once again.

BRAND NEW PREDATOR KILLER OF KILLERS EXTENDED ENDING FEATURING DUTCH AND MIKE HARRIGAN pic.twitter.com/xoDYwLmLFP

— MOVIEDEATHS (@MOVIEDEATHBLOWS) July 26, 2025

The extended version of Killer of Killers is out now, so fans are already analyzing it to within an inch of its life. Reaction appears to be mixed. While some are excited about the iconic characters' return, some are disappointed with the idea that the Yautja kidnap victorious humans in the first place. Let’s remember the iconic scene at the end of Predator 2 where an elder Yautja rewards Harrigan with an antique flintlock pistol as a trophy. The suggestion now is Harrigan was later kidnapped and put in stasis, which some believe devalues the human victories seen in previous Predator movies.

“It just feels like shit knowing your favorite human survivors are just going to be kidnapped and probably killed in an arena by another human or by the Warlord,” said redditor Vector_Mortis.

“Why would the Yautja congratulate Harrigan, give him the pistol, and leave just to come back, take the pistol, and kidnap him?” wondered Slow_Obligation2286.

“I'm not a fan of this at all,” added Hanesman12. “Harrigan and Dutch had good endings. Zero reason this needed to be done. Purely nostalgia bait.”

“This removes everything we previously knew about Dutch and Harrigan’s timelines after the movies,” said Originalname888. “This removes the honor code. This removes everything.”

Fans are now latching onto a potential explanation for what is going on here: that the whole kidnap human survivors thing is the work of the Yautja tribe we see in Killer of Killers, which does not represent the Yautja as a whole. Perhaps this particular tribe has gone rogue and will eventually be put in its place. On that we’ll have to wait and see, but what is irrefutable is that it is now canon that Dutch and Harrigan were kidnapped soon after the events of their movies and remain in stasis at this undetermined point in the future.

But there’s an additional tricky Predator lore question that revolves around Dutch. 2020’s Predator: Hunting Grounds, developed by IllFonic, features Arnold Schwarzenegger reprising his role as Dutch. In the run up to the game’s release, the developers talked about working with people at previous rights holder Fox (this is before Disney bought the company and its franchises) to cement Hunting Grounds’ place within the official Predator lore.

This was exciting for fans as it meant Hunting Grounds officially revealed what happened to Dutch after the events of the first Predator movie — and there was no mention of being kidnapped by Yautja. Indeed, Hunting Grounds shows an older Dutch in the year 2025.

So, is Hunting Grounds no longer canon? Is Trachtenberg ignoring it? Is there another explanation? These are just some of the questions fans are trying to answer in the wake of Dutch’s return in Killer of Killers.

Whatever Trachtenberg’s master plan, there remains huge interest in the upcoming Predator: Badlands, the first 15 minutes of which were shown at Comic-Con. The Alien franchise links are clear, but will there be an AVP movie afterwards? We’ll have to wait and see.

Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me.



https://www.ign.com/articles/predator-fans-mixed-on-return-of-dutch-and-harrigan-in-killer-of-killers-harrigan-and-dutch-had-good-endings-zero-reason-this-needed-to-be-done-sdcc-2025

item.title: 38 minutes of Battlefield 6 multiplayer has leaked
item.content:encoded:
EA’s big reveal of the Battlefield 6 has been scuppered with videos of the multiplayer portion of the game popping up all over the internet.  By far the longest is this 38 minute video showing the game running on a PC with RTX 5090 Ultra settings.

The video includes action on foot, in a tank, and in a jeep, but none from aircraft, although they can be clearly seen whizzing around in the sky and crashing spectacularly. The video has been up for a while so it doesn’t seem like EA are that bothered.

The official Battlefield 6 multiplayer reveal will take place on 31st July.

Here’s the trailer blurb:

Witness the vicious path of destruction carved by Pax Armata, the world’s leading private military company. PAX pursues the destruction of NATO and its allies, stopping at nothing to uphold their motto: “Our Protection, Your Peace.”

Lock & load for the ultimate all-out warfare experience. Fight in high-intensity infantry combat. Rip through the skies in aerial dogfights. Demolish your environment for a strategic advantage. In a war of tanks, fighter jets, and massive combat arsenals, your squad is the deadliest weapon. This is Battlefield 6.

Little is known about who Pax Armata is, but from pre-announcement teasers, they seem to be backed by a growing coalition of other nations. Careful not to step on certain countries’ toes, this isn’t being labelled as a particular nation at this time, and is instead the “Pax Armata Mercenaries”.
Little is known about who Pax Armata is, but from pre-announcement teasers, they seem to be backed by a growing coalition of other nations. Careful not to step on certain countries’ toes, this isn’t being labelled as a particular nation at this time, and is instead the “Pax Armata Mercenaries”.

Following this we get a look at a broad spectrum of Battlefield-like scenarios. There’s cinematic moments with characters calling in military strikes, angrily slapping tables and more, but there’s also paratroopers jumping from planes, there’s beach landing craft coming out of carriers, there’s rocket artillery, there’s dams blowing up and more. It builds up until parts of New York are getting blown up.

The next Battlefield is in development under the collective brand Battlefield Studios, which encapsulates Criterion, DICE, Ripple Effect and Motive Studios. With the launch of Battlefield Labs playtesting earlier this year, we got a glimpse of actual gameplay from the next Battlefield, featuring a map in the Middle East with modern combined forces as tanks and soldiers battle through the streets. There’s clearly an emphasis on flashy map destruction and degradation, building up to a whole building facade being blown up with an RPG.

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/07/26/38-minutes-of-battlefield-6-multiplayer-has-leaked/

item.title: Luto Walkthrough - All Chapters And Full Game Guide
item.content:encoded:
Luto is an unsettling psychological horror game filled with challenging puzzles that can sometimes leave you scratching your head for extended periods. So, whether you'd like to be guided step-by-step through this creepy horror title or simply need help solving one of its clever puzzles, we've got everything you need in our full game walkthrough below. Let's dive in.

Note: We'll list the cards, documents, and items we found during our playthrough, but this is a general walkthrough and doesn't contain the location of every collectible.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Chapter 1 - It's Happening Again
  • Chapter 2 - Beyond the Noise
    • How to get the hammer in Luto
    • How to solve the clock door puzzle in Luto
  • Chapter 3 - One More Time
    • Where to find the stuffed monkeys in the bedroom
  • Chapter 1 - It's Happening Again (revisited)
  • Chapter 4 - Thanks for Pushing Me
    • How to solve the drawings puzzle in Luto
    • How to solve the TV symbols puzzle in Luto
    • Where to find the stuffed monkeys in the sketch room
    • How to open the chest for the mum's items puzzle in Luto
    • How to solve the House of Lost Dreams puzzle in Luto
  • Chapter 5 - Playing with the Truth
    • How to solve the hangman puzzle
  • Chapter 22 - A Mouth Full of Sand Can't Scream
    • How to solve the forward and backward puzzle
  • Chapter 3 - One More Time (revisited)

Chapter 1 - It's Happening Again

You begin the game in a desert on Monday. Move forward until a sandstorm begins. When prompted, press the button displayed on your screen rapidly.

When you regain control in the next segment, turn around and leave the bathroom.

In the hallway, turn left and walk forward. Grab the note resting on the banister to your left, then continue forward and down the stairs on the right.

In the next room, walk forward until you reach an entryway table against the left wall. Take a document from the trash beside the table. Afterward, pick up the keys from the table and open the front door of the house.

Now, it's Tuesday. Leave the bathroom again, then run when you're told to.

Wednesday comes next. Leave the bathroom once more, head down the stairs again, and then interact with the sketchbook on the floor.

Now, use the other door in this room to go to the basement. Down here, head to the desk against the back wall, then pick up the card and document sitting on it.

Return to the bathroom upstairs and get the keys from the sink. Afterward, go back downstairs and open the front door once again.

It's now Thursday. Head back downstairs again and answer the phone on the entryway table.

Go back to the basement, this time interacting with the trap door in front of the desk from before, and choose to enter it.

Chapter 2 - Beyond the Noise

Make your way down the ladder, then pass through the next two doors.

In the living room, pick up a sheet of paper from the side table, then head down the hallway to the right of it.

On your way down the stairs here, stop and pick up a card sitting in a hole in the wall. Additionally, pick up the little note from the ladder at the bottom of the stairs.

Look up at the light above you in the room with the stairs. Notice a hammer there? We need that.

How to get the hammer in Luto

Head forward and take a right to find another table with a phone on it. Pick up the sketchbook page here, then pick up the phone and press "SOS" three times.

This will cause the hammer to fall. Return to the area with the staircase and pick up the hammer from the floor. You'll use this shortly.

Backtrack and take a left into the next hallway this time.

Down this hallway on the right is a door with clocks around it. To open this door, you need to find seven clocks.

How to solve the clock door puzzle in Luto

For a clock to count as "found", you just need to interact with it.

Continue forward into a bathroom. Clock 1 is in the bathtub.

Leave the bathroom and walk back down the hallway. Clock 2 is leaning against the wall next to a vase in front of the glass door.

Clock 3 is located halfway up the stairs you originally came down.

Now, walk over to where you picked up the phone and look up between two wooden beams to find Clock 4.

Continue past the phone and go down the stairs. Down here, you'll find Clock 5 in a chair.

Open the next door and follow the hallway to find yourself back in the living room. Clock 6 is beneath the side table.

From where you entered this room, head forward into the next hallway and into a lit room on the left to find a card.

Leave this room and head the way you came from, stopping at the boarded-off door. Use the hammer to remove the nails here, then enter the room. Clock 7 is on the floor here.

Pick up the drawing beside the final clock and the card on a box in this room, then leave.

Return to the clock door, which can now be opened, and enter the next room.

Pick up a ripped note on the left and take the stuffed monkey hanging from the ceiling.

Return to the phone in the hallway. Dial the number 555-1725.

After the dialogue completes, turn and look down the hallway to see a figure that has emerged.

Dip into the room on the right and run down the hallway. Eventually, you'll see a little toy ambulance in front of you, so follow it until it crashes into a door, then enter it and walk down the stairs.

Take the sketchbook page from the table on the left, then go through the door.

Follow the path until you reach the bathroom again. Pick up the note here, then turn around.

A coin will be floating in front of you now. Move toward it to trigger a scene.

Select any dialogue options here until you wake up inside a cave.

Make your way through the cave until you come across a familiar desert. As you did at the beginning of the game, press the button displayed on your screen rapidly when the sandstorm begins. Eventually, the screen will fade to black.

Chapter 3 - One More Time

You're once again in the bathroom. Leave and head down the hallway, stopping to pick up the document on the right before going downstairs.

Grab the keys from the entryway table and leave through the front door.

You'll now cycle through each day of the week. On Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, simply leave the bathroom and interact with the document again before heading downstairs, getting the keys, and leaving through the front door.

When Friday arrives, a door on the left in the hallway can be opened to reveal a bedroom.

Grab the sketchbook page from the desk, then interact with the corkboard. Place the monkey drawing in the slot on the lower right.

Next, place the stuffed monkey you found earlier on the bed next to the other one.

Look away, and suddenly the stuffed monkeys have disappeared. You'll need to find them around the room now.

Where to find the stuffed monkeys in the bedroom

Find them on the bookshelf above the computer, then turn around. Find them on the fan above you, then turn around. Find them in the laundry basket to the left of the TV, then turn around. Lastly, find them on the shelf to the right of the TV. Interact with them to get an eyeball.

Leave the room, go left down the hallway, and pick up the document on the right once more. Go downstairs, grab the keys, and leave through the front door.

You're back in the bathroom. Head downstairs yet again. When you reach the bottom of the stairs, grab the flashlight in front of you and turn it on.

Grab the sketchbook page on the front door, then turn around. Pick up and read the stamp on the table near the stairs, then head back up to the hallway.

Upstairs, there are four descending photos on the left wall. Interact with the fourth (lowest) one to get a key. You can also grab a document from the back of the fallen picture.

Go back downstairs and open the little lockbox on the table using the key you just found. Take the tiny Entrance Door from the lockbox. Weird.

Head through the opening where the front door once was and walk down a creepy corridor until you reach a dilapidated home interior.

Make your way through this linear interior, stopping to grab a card from a metal cart along the way, then go down some stairs to another cave.

Walk through the cave until a large storage box is blocking the path forward. Move the crate out of your way, then enter the door.

Back in the house, go downstairs to answer the ringing phone.

After the dialogue finishes, repeatedly press the button to resist the darkness and head back to the living room to find a door ajar (every other door you approach will slam in your face during this segment).

Open the door and follow the corridor. Open two more doors to find a figure floating on the other side. Continue to resist during this period while walking toward the figure.

Interact with the figure and watch the scene here, then walk toward the ladder ahead.

Suddenly, the narrator will bring up the pause screen and kick you out of the game. Don't worry: This is meant to happen.

Load back in and press "Continue."

Walk toward the glowing figure ahead while resisting. Once you reach the figure and it disappears, stop resisting.

Chapter 1 - It's Happening Again (revisited)

Guess what? You're back in the bathroom.

Head to the stairs as usual and go down them. However, they will loop for a very long time. Just keep going until you come to a hole you can descend.

Chapter 4 - Thanks for Pushing Me

Head forward until you reach a door on the left leading to a room with a blue hue.

Enter the room, then pick up the sketchbook page on the left. Take note of the board on the wall here that is missing drawings. We'll be returning later.

Leave the room for now.

Continue forward, stopping to pick up a note on your right before heading left past a boarded-off door.

Up ahead is the bathroom, which now has a tub filled with blood. Go past it and take a left at the fork. Walk up the stairs.

Pick up the drawing on the bannister.

Return to the fork and take the right path this time. Walk down the stairs.

Pick up the drawing on the floor.

Next, continue winding through this room until you reach a door with a gate. Interact with the gate and take the Golden Piece.

Go back upstairs and turn right into a hallway where only one door is cracked open. Enter the room.

Pick up the card on the desk, then go through the next door.

Take a left and head in the direction of the boarded-off door ahead. Before reaching it, stop and turn right to see a corridor full of doors.

At the end of this hallway is a door with a gate. Use the Golden Piece to open it.

Go down the stairs and interact with the door here to get the Moon and Sun Knocker and reveal another set of stairs. We'll return here shortly.

For now, head back to where the path forked left and right. Take the right path again and enter a corridor full of doors.

Take a left while listening for a door with a ringing sound coming from within. It will be the second door on your right.

Place the Moon and Sun Knocker on this door, then use it to knock. The door will open, so head inside.

Answer the phone and go through the conversation.

Make your way through this area until you see a glowing blue door at the end of a hallway. Walk toward it, but stop to grab the drawing on a table on your right.

Go through the glowing blue door, turn right, and head toward the large gate ahead.

Open the gate and pass through it, follow the stairs down, and grab the Silver Piece from the shrine.

Go back upstairs and backtrack. Eventually, you'll see a ghost pass in front of a door. Head through that door, take a right, and make your way toward another open door.

The ghost will attack you, sending you into a dialogue scene. Select your choices, then you'll wake up the cave yet again.

Continue forward until you once again reach a glowing figure. Resist until you reach the figure, then stop resisting.

And you're back in the bathroom again. Surprise!

Leave the bathroom and return to the room with the blue hue where you saw the board with missing drawings.

How to solve the drawings puzzle in Luto

You have to place the drawings in the correct spots:

  • "Look for the signs amidst all the noise" - Drawing of Strange Symbols
  • "Find the childhood that hides from pain" - Drawing of Two Monkeys
  • "Escape for the false prison of memories" - Drawing of a Canarian House

Now, leave the room and take a left. Follow the path back around to where it forks. Take the left path and go upstairs.

There's now a glowing red room at the top with a videotape in a window. Interact with it to make it fall downstairs.

Turn around to see a figure has spawned behind you. It won't bother you, so just walk past it and make your way back down the stairs.

In a basket by the bathroom ahead is the videotape. Pick it up.

Follow the path back around to a room with a bunch of TVs.

A TV located in the center of the room says "No Signal," so interact with it and place the videotape inside the built-in VCR.

You'll now be controlling a character on the TV.

Go down the stairs nearby, then take some more stairs on the left.

You'll eventually see some TVs with symbols before the screen goes black and resets you somewhere else.

Walk through a sequence of pathways that will constantly reset. Eventually, you'll leave the TV and be yourself (?) again.

A new door will now be open directly in front of you, but you don't need to enter it currently.

Leave the TV room, then take an immediate right. Go back through the door you opened earlier with the Golden Piece and follow it all the way to the end to reach three TVs.

How to solve the TV symbols puzzle in Luto

Interact with the glowing red TVs and enter the following symbols from top to bottom:

  • Top TV - Spiral
  • Middle TV - Single middle line with two half-circles on top and bottom
  • Bottom TV - Three triangles (tri-force)

A door will now open. Go through it.

Follow the left path around until you find a figure wearing glasses in front of a red static screen. Take Sam's Broken Glasses.

Turn around to go back. You'll soon fall through a hole.

Walk forward, then look to the right and grab the sketchbook page from the banister. Now head back left.

Follow the path back to the room with all of the TVs. Leave the room and go forward, heading to the left of the boarded-off door. to reach the fork again.

Take the right path and go down the stairs to the room with all the sketches.

Pick up the sketchbook page from the crate ahead, then take note of the monkeys once again. Here we go.

Where to find the stuffed monkeys in the sketch room

Look at the monkeys hanging from the crate, then turn around. Find the monkeys to the right of the crate on a shelf next to a basketball, then turn around. Find the monkeys hanging from the ceiling behind a sketch, then turn around. Find the monkeys on the ground behind a sketch near a gated door, then turn around. Find the monkeys on a crate near the last spot you found them.

Pick up Isaac's Deflated Ball.

Now, go over to the gated door and use the Silver Piece to open it. Downstairs, make your way through the linear path until you reach a red valve on a metal cart. Pick it up.

Leave the way you came. The screen will start shaking, closing off the door you originally used to come through here. Instead, there's now a small hole you can enter.

Walk forward, pick up the coin, and pay no mind to the red spider that pops up. At the end of the corridor, move the crate out of your way.

Go down the stairs in the maintenance hallway here to reach a red pipe where you can attach the valve. This will allow you to stop the blood from flowing down the ladder in front of you.

Go down the ladder and walk forward. Pick up Joel's Dull Heart.

Go back up and head into the section with the flickering blue light.

Directly to your right is an open door leading into a room with a rocking chair and a chest on a table.

First, grab the sketchbook page on the table to your right, then the note on the table near the rocking chair.

Place the Entrance Door into the door slot located on the photo on the wall.

Now, you need to find a way to open the chest.

How to open the chest for the mum's items puzzle in Luto

The note you picked up a moment ago gives you hints on how to get the combination for the lock by counting items around the room. But if you want to bypass that process, enter the number: 3715.

You'll hear a knock at the tiny door in the frame. Open it. Take Eva's Shattered Photograph from inside.

Return once again to the maintenance hall and back down the stairs where the large gate was. You'll know it's the right spot if says "House of Lost Dreams" above it.

You now have the four items needed to solve the puzzle that awaits you at the bottom.

How to solve the House of Lost Dreams puzzle in Luto

You need to place four items on the trays beneath the paintings in this room. There are clues to be found in your sketchbook, but you can skip that altogether using the solutions below:

  • El Amanecer – Eva’s Shattered Photograph
  • El Mediodia – Isaac’s Deflated Ball
  • La tarde – Sam’s Broken Glasses
  • La noche – Joel’s Dull Heart

After placing the items, attempt to leave. A levitating figure will appear, so resist by pressing the button on your screen as usual. Keep doing so as you approach the figure, then interact with it to trigger a scene.

When you try to leave again, a painting will fall off the wall to reveal a hole you can pass through.

Make your way down the claustrophobic hallway of pictures for a while until the screen goes black, sending you back to... the bathroom again.

Leave the bathroom and start down the hallway. A figure will appear and drop into a picture on the floor. Follow it through.

You're back in the bathroom, of course. Leave again and walk forward a bit, but do not enter the frame this time. Instead, turn around to find a new staircase has appeared where the bathroom once was.

Go down the stairs and through a door into a flooded hallway.

At the split, go left. Take a left down a short hallway and enter the door here.

When presented with two small hallways, each leading to doors, choose the one with the House For Sale sign near it.

Walk down a hallway, turn right to find two more small hallways with doors, and again choose the left one with the House For Sale sign near it.

You'll enter an eerie scene with a figure in front of a moon. Walk toward the moon until the scene ends.

Continue through the claustrophobic hallway of pictures until you emerge from the bathroom mirror, then take the note from the door here.

Leave the bathroom. You'll be attacked by the figure again.

Choose your dialogue options, then you'll be back in the desert, where you'll need to work your way back into the house.

Run toward the figure in the distance while resisting. It will disappear when you reach it, but you'll be able to look around and spot another one. Keep running (while resisting) toward it until you reach it, then the screen will close in and... well, you can probably guess where you're headed.

Yeah, you're back in the bathroom.

Turn around and pick up the coin. Then take a few steps back and enter the door leading into a dark hallway.

Chapter 5 - Playing with the Truth

Continue forward and down a set of stairs, then take a right and follow the path around to a set of stairs going up.

Take the card on the ground at the top of the stairs, then take a left here, and take the stairs leading down on your right at the end of the hallway.

In the next room, take the sketchbook page from the table on the right.

Up ahead is another fork. Go to the right first and take a card sitting atop a painting, then head back around and go left to grab the Staff Key at the dead end.

Backtrack to the level above you and walk forward through the hallway to a door that says "Staff Only". Use the Staff Key to open the door.

In the Staff Room, wrap around to the left and take the videotape from the stack of boxes, then leave the Staff Room.

Walk forward until you find a white door on the left just past the staircase.

Interact with the white door multiple times until it finally opens.

Inside the next room, touch the TV to insert the videotape, and then you'll find yourself within it as you were before.

Walk forward and interact with the figure with an "O" above its head to make it disappear, then continue ahead until you reach a room with multiple figures with letters above their heads.

In this segment, you'll need to solve a hangman puzzle.

How to solve the hangman puzzle

On the left of the TV are six sheets of paper. You need to spell a specific word by touching the figures with the correct letters above their heads. Below these six sheets is another sheet of paper with a game of hangman that will advance each time you pick an incorrect letter. Once the hangman is finished, you'll be kicked out of the TV and have to start over.

As usual, referring to your sketchbook can help you solve this puzzle, but for the sake of moving things along, the correct letters are R-O-M-P-E-R.

The figures are scattered throughout various rooms within the TV world, so take your time and be thorough. It can take a while to find every letter needed.

When you complete the puzzle, you'll leave the TV.

Leave the room and start backtracking down the stairs toward where the chapter started. At the bottom of the stairs, turn left and enter the door here.

Turn right and walk down the hallway of doors. Sprint down this hallway until you hit a box that says "Load Level", causing the screen to go black.

Chapter 22 - A Mouth Full of Sand Can't Scream

You'll wake up in a very dark room. Look around for a coin in the distance and walk toward it.

Collect the coin, then head back toward the light behind you until the screen goes black and you start over.

This time, listen for a weird sound in the distance and make your way in its direction.

Eventually, you'll come across a radio. Interact with it to make it disappear.

Afterward, there will be two more radios to find in the darkness. Follow the sounds to them. Interacting with one of these will spawn a dog bed in the light with a second sketchbook page. The other will be near a table with a sketchbook page you can pick up before you get close to it. It will disappear on its own.

When the final radio disappears, you'll spawn in front of a glowing, levitating figure. Resist as usual, pressing forward until you can reach the figure and interact with it to end the sequence.

Follow the sound once more to a final radio. Interact with this one to bring up a frequency slider. Move the slider below 53 AM and wait a few moments.

A figure will appear and spawn a "Load Level" box in front of you. Enter it.

You're back in the hallway of doors. Walk forward and enter the open door on the left.

In this room are two boxes: Forward and Backward. It's puzzle time.

How to solve the forward and backward puzzle

This one is easier than it looks at a glance.

At the end of this area is a major Out of Bounds gap that will teleport you back to the start of the room when touched. The Forward and Backward boxes here will make all the toy ambulances in the room go, well, forward or backward.

Spot a toy ambulance on the floor by the door you first entered. Pass through the Backward box, then follow that toy ambulance through the room while bypassing the Forward box altogether.

As the toy ambulance reaches the Out of Bounds gap, walk atop it and ride it across to the other side.

If you mess up and find the toy ambulance is lost on the other side of the Out of Bounds gap, just use the Forward box to bring it back to you and start over.

Enter the door ahead and turn left. Answer the phone down the hall, listen to the dialogue, then hang up.

Turn around and go up the staircase (where you initially got the hammer earlier in the game).

At the top of the stairs, turn left and go through the door here, then walk toward the Play Music box ahead.

Walk through this corridor, climb the ladder at the end, and interact with the trap door at the top a few times.

The narrator will once again kick you out. As last time, this is normal.

Load back in and press "Continue" multiple times to cycle through the narrator's dialogue. This can take a while. Eventually, a scene will begin.

After the scene, you'll be inside a game called 30/03. This functions as a mini-game where you have to avoid red spiders while collecting hearts to deposit in the center of a building. While there's a trophy/achievement for beating it, failing is the primary method of moving forward in the story, so pause the game and choose to exit.

Once this sequence ends, you'll be back in the bathroom, which shouldn't surprise you at all by now.

Leave the bathroom and head toward the Trigger Title box ahead. Before you reach it, dip into the area on the left to grab a sketchbook page.

Enter the Trigger Title box.

Chapter 3 - One More Time (revisited)

Open the first door you come to, then head to the end of the room and pick up the keys.

Leave the room, continue down the hallway, and walk down the stairs. Interact with the front door.

Head forward into the bathroom, then turn around and re-enter the Trigger Title box.

Go downstairs again and pass through the Change Day box at the front door.

Wrap around and walk through the Increase Speed box, then follow the path until you enter a room with a lot of doors with words above them.

Enter the Teleport door.

Walk through the Play Music and Light Candles boxes.

When presented with a choice to go left or right, choose either. They both lead to the same place.

Walk all the way forward to a metal cart and pick up a card.

Now head down the path and through the gate under the words "House of Lost Dreams". At the end of this area, you'll drop back down into the room with all the doors.

Walk around the side of this area to spot a radio on a table. Pick it up. This is Joel's Radio. You can take it out and tune it a second time for a trophy/achievement if you wish.

Afterward, continue around the room until you can go to the right to see a long staircase leading up. There will be a figure there. Walk toward the figure to pass through the staircase.

Afterward, you'll find yourself in a room with a red button. There's a door to the right of it. Ignore the button and head through the door.

You'll come to a room with a small moon and a large moon. Push the small moon behind the large moon, then push it into the Out of Bounds hole. Immediately follow it down.

At the bottom, walk up to the figure and interact with it to start a scene.

After the scene, pick up the sketchbook page from the chair and begin to walk around the room until the narrator indicates there's nothing left for you to do here.

Exit to the main menu, then press "Continue."

When you reappear, you'll be in the desert. While resisting, move around the desert and walk into four glowing figures.

The last glowing figure will be sitting next to a cardboard box. Interact with it and choose to go inside.

Answer some dialogue options.

When you awaken in darkness, walk toward the two glowing lights.

Turn around and face away from them to trigger a lengthy scene full of dialogue options. Make your choices.

When it's all said and done, walk toward the two lights once again to spawn on a beach.

Walk forward and interact with the figure ahead.

You'll be taken back to the bathroom a final time. Head downstairs, take the keys from the entryway table, and head out the front door to finish the game.
